title: Battery Array
content: The **Battery Array** is a machine. How do I put this in the WIP category lol ## Technicals Stores energy, and keeps it for long time

title: The D.E.M
content: The D.E.M. is a black hole based full mass to energy conversion device that uses black holes to convert matter into GigaWatts or even TeraWatts of power. # A massive warning that the info in the dem page is incorrect because it literally spreads misinformation ### Structure add a gallery when you get evenly square versions of the individual compopnents of the D.E.M. Component List of images to add * Proper Square Full Render * Core * Horizon Scrubber * Power Laser * Power Extractors * Stabilizer * Startup Manifold (Only if its easy to get) #### Core * This is the black hole core of the D.E.M. where hawking radiation for power generation comes from * This is only present while the D.E.M. is in operations, or as a ball of compressed matter during startup, which then gets compressed by gravitational amplification * The core is kept stable using a gravity shield that prevents the gravity of the black hole from extending past intended boundaries * The core is generally being orbited by the accretion disc, which is the disc of matter falling into the core to generate power, this disc can stall if complete desaturation is allowed, but the accretion disc can simply be reformed #### Horizon Scrubber * Prevents the atmosphere inside the room from reaching into the accretion disc, which would uncontrollably saturate the disc, potentially destabilizing the gravity shield by throwing core parameters out of control * It does not prevent anything from falling into it, allowing the accretion disc to be resaturated during operations using any form of matter #### Power Lasers * Stabilizes one part of the D.E.M.'s Operation, wether it'd be the accretion disc's rotational energy or thermal energy, or causing EMR flux in the core or feeding it some mass #### Power Extractors * Extracts power from the core using the emitted hawking radiation, due to how accelerated the hawking radiation decay process is, this generates a lot of power #### Stabilizers * Stabilizes the gravitational shield, preventing the black hole from tearing the facility and the planet apart #### Startup Manifold * Generates the accretion disc ### Operation Parameters #### Global Laser Offset * Offsets the lasers from the singularity of the core, eventually changing their modes across 4 different overall modes # Extremely Low Offset: Feeds the singularity directly, slightly increasing core mass # Low Offset: Enters the EMRIRS Without hitting the singularity, causing superradiant scattering within the EMRIRS and eventually exiting back out as EMR Flux # Medium Offset: Low leverage on the accretion disc, warming it up more than it adds rotational energy to it # High Offset: High leverage on the accretion disc, adding rotational energy more than it warms it up #### Global Power Laser * Acts as a general multiplier to the effect of the current laser offset's mode #### EMRIR Shield Density * Increases EMR Flux ** This would increase the accretion disc temperature based on how high this gets ** This would decrease the gravity shield's stress based on how high this gets #### Horizon Scrubber Engage Percentage * Decreases Accretion Disc Saturation ** This decreases core spin due to having less matter to fall into the core *** This is also based on how fast the disc is spinning * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Field Compression Control * Increases hawking radiation by reducing core mass ** This increases power generation * <u>THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING</u> #### Electron Injection * Increases Reactor Charge ** This causes higher disc de-saturation ** This causes lightning bolt strike if get too high ( 9000-12000 ) ## Crucial Components Missing: Proper & Square D.E.M. Control Panel Image <gallery> File:Mainframe.webp|The Main Computer </gallery> ### Control Panel * Used to operate the D.E.M. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network <sub>First Edition Composed by loltnt_pvp</sub> ## Trivia # The D.E.M.'s full name is "Superradiant Scattering Type Full Mass Conversion Electromagnetic Radiation Internally Reflecting Shield Dark Energy Manipulator Reactor", SSTFMCEMRIRSDEMR For short. ## Related Links Cooocki and FJSAGS have put together some notes on how D.E.M. works: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JwTdfeakhBpCm71j09fPvbVEmozJ9vUW4yS5e0n3jAc?tab=t.0

title: C.R.R.
content: ## Description The <b>Catalyzed Redstone Reactor</b> or <b>C.R.R.</b> is an addon to the TERF datapack. Designed to be the second reactor after the [M.C.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/MCFR) utilizing the Helium-4 that it produces. It is a Matter Conversion Reactor that generates power by absorbing saturation from the core. The <b>C.R.R.</b> has three different parts, the Catalyzer, Energy Collector, and the Projector. You will need to constantly add Redstone, Amethyst Blocks, and Ender Pearls to the <b>C.R.R.</b> to keep it operational. ## C.R.R. Operations To begin the startup process, you will need to input redstone, amethyst blocks, ender pearls, and 500 mB of Helium-4 into the <b>C.R.R.</b> Be aware, there can be a 5% chance for the <b>C.R.R.</b> to potentially have a Startup Failure. The controls below describes what they affect. <b>Saturation Extraction Rate</b> - The rate that the Energy Collector extracts Saturation<br> <b>Catalyzer Injection</b> - Increases C. Catalyzer<br> <b>™B Projection</b> - Reduces Shield Stress by using up more F. Shield ## Emergency Operations ### Meltdown Core Temperature will increase the <b>C.R.R.</b>'s Shield Stress. If the Shield Stress reaches above 100%, it will begin to degrade the shield. Increasing Saturation Extraction Rate and decreasing Catalyzer Injection may help to decrease stress. You can also use Catalyzer Annihilation to decrease Saturation.<br> If you also run out of F. Shield, this will also cause the shield to degrade.<br> Once the shield breaks, this begins the process of the second stage of meltdown. You will need to perform restabilization before the <b>C.R.R.</b> reaches stage three meltdown. You will need to input water into the <b>C.R.R.</b>, activate Catalyzer Annihilation, and injecting reaction inhibitor, once these are completed it will proceed to shut down the <b>C.R.R.</b> <br> If you fail to input water and use the Catalyzer Annihilation, the <b>C.R.R.</b> will reach stage three meltdown, it is best to evacuate the area as the core is unable to be saved. The <b>C.R.R.</b> will begin to leak out rays that can injure personnel and damage the area around it. After a while, the reactor will blow up and leave behind a crater. ### Stall If you run out of C. Redstone or have 0% saturation, the reactor may begin to stall. Unlike the [S.T.F.R.](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/STFR), this will not lead to the reactor freezing. It will then give you two options: remove the key and shut down the reactor or reignite the reactor again. ### Startup Failure There is a 5% change for startup failure to occur. If this does happen, this will start to cause the shield to form unstable, to prevent the <b>C.R.R.</b> from summoning a Resonance Cascade, you will need to kill the green particles that fly around the room. Once they have been all removed, the <b>C.R.R.</b> will return to normal operation. ## C.R.R. Logistics There is no limit for Core Temp but the higher it goes, the more Shield Stress is gained. Ender pearls increase F. Shield, Redstone increases C. Redstone, and Amethyst Blocks increase F. Catalyzer when it is low. ## Trivia The <b>C.R.R.</b> was inspired by the Anti Mass Spectrometer from the Half-Life series and the Dark Energy Construct from Garry's Mod. The **C.R.R** wasn't developed by Jona, instead it was coded by Cooocki and built by Kaiden

title: Hadron Collider
content: The Hadron Collider is a machine in the TERF Facility, used to smash items into other items at high speeds to create new items. It is a major part of the [Netherite Refining Process](https://trotywiki.miraheze.org/wiki/Netherite_Refining_Process). ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the Interface Cauldron facing forwards **Power Input:** Into the Interface as seen in tutorial video **Power Consumption(MW):** <math>Length \times 16</math> ## Build Tutorial

title: OpenCore
content: The OpenCore is a furnace that uses two positron emission units to remelt items many times more efficiently than basic methods. Use of OpenCore can consume from 1000MWh to 10000MWh ## Technicals **Multiblock Core Placement:** Into the iron blocks at the bottom **Power Input:** Into the conductor blocks ## Build Tutorial https://imgur.com/a/RC9NZsx Note than the upper part is 4 blocks above the bottom part ##Usage To use OpenCore you need active S.T.F.R which produces more than 500 MWh (Varies depending on the recipe) {| class="wikitable" !Ingredient !Energy (MWh) !Result |- |8x Netherite Scrap |5000 |8x Netherite Ingot |- | 32x Glowstone Dust |2000 |24x Blaze Powder |- |4x Emerald Block |7200 |3x Diamond Block |- | 20x Quartz |900 |20x Amethyst Shards |- |4x Amethyst Block |6000 |1x Ochre Froglight |- |1x Netherite Block |10000 |1x Heavy Core |} If you meet the requirements, you can start-up OpenCore and start using it. After confirming start-up sequence, you will start getting temperature "orders" you need to meet. You can find them at sign above centre of control panel. If you fail to meet order you will face consequences. If recipe was simple (froglight, amethyst shards, blaze powder) you will just get small explosion/photons, else, if there was difficult recipe (netherite ingots, diamond blocks, heavy core) you will get medium/large explosion. Full tutorial: https://youtu.be/xkQwBeZJXUA <small>*Written by LogicLogger*</small> <small>*Corrections & build tutorial by Sony*</small>

title: The S.T.F.R
content: The S.T.F.R. is a fusion reactor located in the Troty Energy Research Facility ### <big>Structure</big> <gallery> File:STFRrender.webp|The S.T.F.R. File:STFRCaseRender.webp|The encasing superstructure of S.T.F.R. File:Area render 11 .webp|The core of S.T.F.R. during operation File:StabiliserRender.webp|One of six S.T.F.R. stabilisers </gallery>The S.T.F.R. consists of 6 stabilisers, an encasing superstructure and the main core #### Core * This is the core of fusion reaction, where the main processes happen * This core is only present inside the superstructure when the reactor is in operation * The core consists of a shield layer and internal deuterium-deuterium based fusion core * The shield layer consists of one regenerative primary shield, one regenerative internal shield and three non-regenerative shields #### Case * The encasing superstructure is a sphere-like structure around the core of the reactor * As the core generates heat during operation, the heat is transferred to the case, where coolant is boiled into steam and directed to steam turbines to generate power #### Stabilisers * The stabilisers play a crucial role in keeping the core in a stable state and preserving the integrity of core shields ## Crucial Components <gallery> File:BreakersRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Electrical Breakers File:CoolantPumpRender.webp|S.T.F.R. Coolant Pump File:ControlPanel.webp|S.T.F.R. Control Panel File:SteamTurbine.webp|Steam Turbine </gallery> ### Breakers * The breakers supply the S.T.F.R. with DC current * The__INDEX__y are only needed during startup or restabilisation * AC current is input at the bottom conductor; DC is output from the top conductor ### Coolant Pump * This pump pumps the coolant for the S.T.F.R. ### Control Panel * Used to operate the S.T.F.R. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network ### Turbine and generator * Upon heating up the [https://terf.fandom.com/wiki/The_S.T.F.R#Case reactor case], steam is produced and can be directed into turbines to generate power * Turbines have to be connected with steam pipes to the S.T.F.R. * Turbines have to be connected with coolant pipes to the S.T.F.R. <sub>*<small>Composed by SonyXM4</small>*</sub>

title: S.T.F.R Stabilization
content: ## S.T.F.R. Controls The operation of the S.T.F.R. can initially look complicated at first glace. Firstly, the image below is the general control area that you will operate the reactor. if this occurs. ## Maximum S.T.F.R. Values <b>Core Spin</b>: 80,000 - 150,000 RPM <b>Core Temperature</b>: 15,000 - 110,000 °C <b>Core Pressure</b>: 280,000 kPa <b>Case Pressure</b>: 80,000 kPa <b>Case Temperature</b>: 1,000 °C ## S.T.F.R. Logistics For every 5000 RPM of <b>Core Spin</b> will give you 1% of <b>MSSR</b>, <b>Magnetic Shield Stress Reduction</b>, this will decrease <b>Shield Stress</b> that is made by Core and Case Temperature, Pressure, and <b>Core Spin</b> by 1%. It is recommended for <b>Core Pressure</b> to be double of <b>Core Temperature</b>. It is also recommended to monitor the <b>Fuel Usage</b> to match the rate of <b>Fuel Injection</b>. The amount of <b>Case Pressure</b> affects the <b>Heat Transfer Rate</b> (<b>HTR</b>) between the core and the case. For every 3m°C/t is equal to 1MW. One turbine can only handle 5000m°C/t of <b>HTR</b>. The Troty Energy Research Facility have 6 turbines which adds up to 30k m°C/t of <b>HTR</b>. It is preferred to keep <b>Cooling Lasers</b> off unless your <b>Case Pressure</b> is below 15-20 kPa.
